result.execSummary:
The defendant Fue Chang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.  

No contact with P.X. unless approved by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Continue with SAFE program. 

AODA and follow through. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  

DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fue Chang

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:57 pm 
INCLUDES 16CM832 AND 15CM2422. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty Dave Casey. 

PLEA HEARING IN 16CM832.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Misd BJ)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

MOTION TO REVOKE DEOJ IN 15CM2422. 
State notes parties are stipulating to entry of judgment on Ct. 1 (DC/DA). VRCW. 
COURT revokes DEOJ agreement and enters judgment on Ct. 1. 

SENTENCING HEARING IN 16CM832 AND 15CM2422. 
COURT ORDERS: In 16CM832 on Ct. 1 and in 15CM2422 on Ct. 1>>SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: continue with SAFE program; AODA and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no contact with P.X. unless approved by agent; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 2 DA surcharges. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 1 day jail credit in each case. 

Adj: 2:08 pm
Motion hearing on July 15, 2016 at 10:45 am.
to Revoke Deferred Entry of Judgment of Count One - stj
ATTIC DV-VIP Program Acceptance & Recommendation - stj

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:16 pm 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, pro se. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (DC/DA)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & defers entry of judgment. 

COURT ORDERS: DEOJ for 6-9 months with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ, it will move to dismiss the charge. 
Review set for August 26, 2016 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA. 

Adj: 2:27 pm

Shall not consume alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. Absolute sobriety. WPD police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.   No contact with P.X. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. 3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
